alert.note: Alert for Chisago (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 22 at 9:16PM CST until February 23 at 12:00AM CST by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...ACCUMULATING SNOW TAPERS OFF AND HAZARDOUS WIND CHILLS EXPECTED TO DEVELOP THIS EVENING INTO WEDNESDAY MORNING... .Snow continues to exit the region, but areas of drifting snow will continue overnight. Another round of Arctic air will settle in behind the storm system overnight. Wind chills of 25 to 35 below zero are forecast tonight as the cold air moves in. The best chance for the colder part of this range will be over western Minnesota where the winds will remain higher. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT CST TONIGHT... * WHAT...Blowing snow with additional snow accumulations of up to one inch. * WHERE...In Wisconsin, Rusk, Barron and Polk Counties. In Minnesota, Chisago County. * WHEN...Until midnight CST tonight. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. Road conditions can also be found at 511mn.org for Minnesota or 511wi.gov for Wisconsin.
